## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been reading about Verus and its technology, and I'm curious about the significance of the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology in the context of on-chain token currency definition.

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology will enable Verus network chains to operate fully independently, yet be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash. This means that multiple chains can earn rewards and be powered simultaneously, providing fractional currency capabilities for both on-chain tokens and native zk-SNARK supporting currencies. This technology has far-reaching implications for the flexibility and scalability of the Verus network.

**User:**
That's really interesting. I've also been playing around with the `sendcurrency` API, and I was wondering, how do I send VRSCTEST from a single address to a single recipient using the `sendcurrency` API?

**AI Assistant:**
You can send VRSCTEST from a single address to a single recipient using the following command:

```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]'
```

This command will send 10 VRSCTEST from the address "bob@" to the address "alice@".

**User:**
What if I want to send VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to multiple recipients using the `sendcurrency` API?

**AI Assistant:**
You can send VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to multiple recipients using the following command:

```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@","amount":10}]'
```

This command will send 10 VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to both "alice@" and "bob@".

**User:**
How do I convert VRSCTEST to another currency, such as TESTCOIN, using the `sendcurrency` API?

**AI Assistant:**
You can convert VRSCTEST to another currency, such as TESTCOIN, using the following command:

```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"TESTCOIN"}]'
```

This command will convert 10 VRSCTEST to TESTCOIN and send it to the address "bob@".

**User:**
What if I want to preconvert VRSCTEST to a new currency, such as NEWCOIN, before it is active, using the `sendcurrency` API?

**AI Assistant:**
You can preconvert VRSCTEST to a new currency, such as NEWCOIN, before it is active, using the following command:

```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]'
```

This command will preconvert 10 VRSCTEST to NEWCOIN and send it to the address "alice@". If the conversion fails, the funds will be refunded to "alice@".

**User:**
Finally, what is required to create a currency of a specific name on the Verus network?

**AI Assistant:**
To create a currency of a specific name on the Verus network, you need an ID of the same name. The controller of this ID is the only one who can create a currency of that name, and they can only do so once. This ensures that currency names are unique and controlled by their creators.

What is the significance of the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology in the context of on-chain token currency definition?

The Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology will enable Verus network chains to operate fully independently, yet be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash. This means that multiple chains can earn rewards and be powered simultaneously, providing fractional currency capabilities for both on-chain tokens and native zk-SNARK supporting currencies.

# Preparing for Multi-chain, Dynamic Merge Mining
While this 0.7.1 testnet enables on-chain token currency definition, the same advances will soon be available on the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology which was running on testnet last year. When enabled, this will make it possible for Verus network chains to operate fully independently, yet be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash, earning rewards and powering all chains simultaneously. All network blockchains will provide the same fractional currency capabilities, both for on-chain tokens as well as native zk-SNARK supporting currencies as well.## Sending and Converting Currency
**Warning: All testnet coins/currencies have no value and will disappear whenever VRSCTEST is reset**The `sendcurrency` API can be used to send and convert funds.
**Sending VRSCTEST from a single address (bob@) to a single recipient (alice@):**
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]'
```
**Sending VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to two recipients (alice@ and bob@):**
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@","amount":10}]'
```
**Converting VRSCTEST to another currency, TESTCOIN:**
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"TESTCOIN"}]'
```
**Preconverting to new currency, NEWCOIN, before it is active:**
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]'
```## Defining a CurrencyTo create a currency of a specific name, you need an ID of the same name. The controller of this ID is the only one who can create a currency of that name, and they can only do so once.
So, let's
